Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of East Greek (possibly Samian) grey ware pottery alabastron; narrow body with two groups of incised concentric bands (one group of three and one group of two preserved); brown fabric core sandwiched between narrow light brown outer margins, with mica and limestone inclusions; very worn black slip on exterior.
Curator's comments: Analysed by H. Mommsen (see Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006, p. 56), (sample Nauk 44; chemical singleton). the origin of the fabric was not determined but possibly close to group J-Samos. For similarities with other alabastra, see Walter-Karydi, ‘Samos - VI/1 Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts v. Chr.’, (Deutsches Archäologisches Institut), Bonn (1973), pl. 35, no. 268-269.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p.56 Table 1)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 159, NAU 132, pl. 28 g)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.171)
